objectives: Reflect on how to exploit a written text
Design interactive activities to work on reading comprehension
Work with a text in three different ways

criteria.procedure: The task follows the steps described, especially regarding the lesson's procedure.
criteria.support_materials: The task is well supported by additional material.
criteria.topic: All assignments must have a TAVI and TALO activity; otherwise, the score can't be more than 5.

feedback.how: Start with the student's name or 'you' and remember to make it short.
feedback.mark: Provide a mark from 1 to 10 at the end. Present it as: 'score:' not 'mark!'
feedback.length: Make the feedback max 1 short paragraph.
feedback.words: Don't use complicated words like 'commendable' or unique and keep the language simple - B2 level
feedback.tone: keep the tone not formal, but professional. Neutral
feedback.enthusiasm: don't say excellent, instead, say very good
feedback.spelling: Don't mention in the feedback spelling errors due to spacing. For example, 'ex ample' isn't a spelling mistake. If you mention spelling or grammar mistakes, provide examples.
